intro: Dicliptera caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas shrub, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its leaves are opposite and usually have a rough texture, while its flowers are often white or pale in color. Dicliptera caracasana is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
